Description: Apple scab is a fungal disease affecting apple trees.
Symptoms: Olive-green to black spots on leaves and fruit.
Traitements: Apply fungicides during early growth stages. Remove and destroy fallen leaves. Use resistant varieties.
Prevention: Prune trees to improve air circulation. Avoid overhead irrigation.

Description: Black rot is a fungal disease affecting apple trees.
Symptoms: Dark, sunken lesions on fruit, and black cankers on branches.
Traitements: Remove and destroy infected fruit and branches. Apply fungicides as needed.
Prevention: Ensure good air circulation by pruning. Avoid wounding the tree.

Description: Cedar apple rust is a fungal disease that requires both cedar and apple trees to complete its life cycle.
Symptoms: Bright orange spots on leaves and fruit.
Traitements: Apply fungicides at early stages. Remove nearby cedar trees if possible.
Prevention: Plant resistant apple varieties. Prune to improve air circulation.

Description: Gray leaf spot is a fungal disease affecting corn.
Symptoms: Small, rectangular, gray to tan lesions on leaves.
Traitements: Apply fungicides as needed. Rotate crops to reduce disease pressure.
Prevention: Plant resistant varieties. Ensure good air circulation.

Description: Common rust is a fungal disease affecting corn.
Symptoms: Reddish-brown pustules on leaves.
Traitements: Apply fungicides if necessary. Remove and destroy infected plant debris.
Prevention: Plant resistant varieties. Ensure good air circulation.

Description: Northern leaf blight is a fungal disease affecting corn.
Symptoms: Long, elliptical gray-green lesions on leaves.
Traitements: Apply fungicides as needed. Remove and destroy infected plant debris.
Prevention: Plant resistant varieties. Rotate crops.

Description: Black rot is a fungal disease affecting grapevines.
Symptoms: Brown, sunken spots on leaves and fruit.
Traitements: Apply fungicides as needed. Remove and destroy infected plant parts.
Prevention: Ensure good air circulation. Avoid overhead watering.

Prevention: Ensure good air circulation. Avoid overhead watering.

Description: Citrus greening is a bacterial disease affecting citrus trees.
Symptoms: Yellowing of leaves, misshapen fruit, and tree decline.
Traitements: Remove and destroy infected trees. Use insecticides to control the vector (Asian citrus psyllid).
Prevention: Plant disease-free stock. Monitor for and control psyllid populations.

Description: Bacterial spot is a disease affecting peach trees caused by the bacterium Xanthomonas campestris.
Symptoms: Water-soaked spots on leaves, fruit, and twigs that turn dark and may drop out.
Traitements: Apply bactericides during early growth stages. Remove and destroy infected leaves and fruit. Use resistant varieties.
Prevention: Avoid overhead irrigation. Ensure proper spacing for good air circulation. Maintain proper sanitation by removing fallen leaves and debris.

Description: Your peach tree is healthy! Here’s how to keep it that way:
Symptoms: N/A

Prevention: N/A

Description: Early blight is a fungal disease affecting potato plants.
Symptoms: Dark, concentric spots on lower leaves, which may yellow and drop off.
Traitements: Apply fungicides at the first sign of disease. Remove and destroy infected plant debris. Rotate crops to reduce disease pressure.
Prevention: Plant resistant varieties. Avoid overhead watering. Ensure good air circulation around plants.

Description: Late blight is a severe fungal disease affecting potato plants.
Symptoms: Water-soaked spots on leaves and stems that turn brown and black, affecting the tubers as well.
Traitements: Apply fungicides regularly during the growing season. Remove and destroy infected plant parts. Use disease-free seed potatoes.
Prevention: Plant resistant varieties. Avoid overhead irrigation. Rotate crops with non-susceptible plants.

Description: Your potato plant is healthy! Here’s how to maintain its health:

Description: Your soybean plant is healthy! Here’s how to maintain its health:
Symptoms: N/A

Description: Powdery mildew is a common fungal disease affecting squash plants.
Symptoms: White, powdery spots on leaves, stems, and flowers.
Traitements: Apply fungicidal sprays as needed. Remove and destroy infected plant parts. Water plants at the base to keep foliage dry.
Prevention: Plant in areas with good air circulation. Avoid overcrowding plants. Apply a layer of mulch to prevent the spread of spores.

Description: Leaf scorch is a fungal disease affecting strawberry plants.
Symptoms: Irregular, dark purple spots on leaves that may merge and turn brown.
Traitements: Remove and destroy infected leaves. Apply fungicides as needed.
Prevention: Avoid overhead watering. Ensure proper spacing for good air circulation. Use resistant varieties if available.

Description: Your strawberry plant is healthy! Here’s how to maintain its health:
Symptoms: N/A

Prevention: N/A

Description: Bacterial spot is a disease affecting tomato plants caused by Xanthomonas campestris.
Symptoms: Small, water-soaked spots on leaves, stems, and fruit that turn dark and may drop out.
Traitements: Apply bactericides during early growth stages. Remove and destroy infected leaves and fruit. Use resistant varieties.
Prevention: Avoid overhead irrigation. Ensure proper spacing for good air circulation. Maintain proper sanitation by removing fallen leaves and debris.

Description: Early blight is a fungal disease affecting tomato plants.
Symptoms: Dark, concentric spots on lower leaves, which may yellow and drop off.
Traitements: Apply fungicides at the first sign of disease. Remove and destroy infected plant debris. Rotate crops to reduce disease pressure.
Prevention: Plant resistant varieties. Avoid overhead watering. Ensure good air circulation around plants.

Description: Late blight is a severe fungal disease affecting tomato plants.
Symptoms: Water-soaked spots on leaves and stems that turn brown and black, affecting the fruit as well.
Traitements: Apply fungicides regularly during the growing season. Remove and destroy infected plant parts. Use disease-free seed potatoes.
Prevention: Plant resistant varieties. Avoid overhead irrigation. Rotate crops with non-susceptible plants.

Description: Leaf mold is a fungal disease affecting tomato plants.
Symptoms: Yellow spots on upper leaf surfaces with a fuzzy, grayish mold on the undersides.
Traitements: Apply fungicides as needed. Remove and destroy infected plant parts.
Prevention: Ensure good air circulation. Avoid overhead watering.

Description: Septoria leaf spot is a fungal disease affecting tomato plants.
Symptoms: Small, circular spots with dark borders on leaves.
Traitements: Apply fungicides as needed. Remove and destroy infected plant parts.
Prevention: Ensure good air circulation. Avoid overhead watering.

Description: Spider mites are tiny pests that can severely damage tomato plants.
Symptoms: Yellowing and stippling of leaves, webbing on plants.
Traitements: Apply miticides as needed. Remove and destroy heavily infested plants.
Prevention: Ensure proper watering and humidity. Monitor regularly for mites.

Description: Target spot is a fungal disease affecting tomato plants.
Symptoms: Small, dark spots on leaves that enlarge and merge.
Traitements: Apply fungicides as needed. Remove and destroy infected plant parts.
Prevention: Plant resistant varieties. Avoid overhead watering. Ensure good air circulation.

Description: Tomato yellow leaf curl virus is a viral disease affecting tomato plants.
Symptoms: Yellowing of leaves, misshapen fruit, and stunted growth.
Traitements: Remove and destroy infected leaves. Use resistant varieties.
Prevention: Control the vector (whitefly). Use resistant varieties.

Description: Tomato mosaic virus is a viral disease affecting tomato plants.
Symptoms: Mosaic pattern on leaves, stunted growth.
Traitements: Apply fungicides as needed. Remove and destroy infected plant parts.
Prevention: Ensure good air circulation. Avoid overhead watering.
